p: The time spent in the open arms of the EPM increased significantly (p < 0.05; F (4,20) = 14) with EOCL administration. EOCL at 50, 100 and 200 mg/kg, i.p., caused 49, 55 and 56% increase in the time spent in the open arms compared to 33 and 72% for negative and positive controls respectively. The EOLC at 50 mg/kg caused significant (P < 0.01) increase in the% number of entries into the open arms compared to negative group ( Fig. 4A–B).
